feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [verbb/comments] Comments plugin stored Cross-site Scripting (XSS) via an asset volume name
entry.content:
An issue was discovered in the Comments plugin before 1.5.5 for Craft CMS. There is stored XSS via an asset volume name.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-13870
  • https://github.com/verbb/comments/blob/craft-3/CHANGELOG.md#155---2020-05-28-critical
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-69ww-wv3j-mhg4

entry.title: [verbb/comments] Comments plugin Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
entry.content:
An issue was discovered in the Comments plugin before 1.5.5 for Craft CMS. CSRF affects comment integrity.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-13868
  • https://github.com/verbb/comments/blob/craft-3/CHANGELOG.md#155---2020-05-28-critical
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4r8c-pj7x-m5jx

entry.title: [verbb/comments] Comments plugin stored Cross-site Scripting via a guest name
entry.content:
An issue was discovered in the Comments plugin before 1.5.5 for Craft CMS. There is stored XSS via a guest name.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-13869
  • https://github.com/verbb/comments/blob/craft-3/CHANGELOG.md#155---2020-05-28-critical
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jhhf-c849-3rh2

entry.title: [codeigniter4/framework] CodeIgniter HTTP Header Injection
entry.content:
British Columbia Institute of Technology CodeIgniter 3.1.3 is vulnerable to HTTP Header Injection in the set_status_header() common function under Apache resulting in HTTP Header Injection flaws.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000247
  • https://www.codeigniter.com/userguide3/changelog.html#version-3-1-4
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j9f9-8j39-4g97

entry.title: [phpbb/phpbb] phpBB Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
entry.content:
phpBB version 3.2.0 is vulnerable to SSRF in the Remote Avatar function resulting allowing an attacker to perform port scanning, requesting internal content and potentially attacking such internal services via the web application.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000419
  • https://www.phpbb.com/community/viewtopic.php?f=14&p=14782136
  • https://www.sec-consult.com/en/blog/advisories/phpbb-server-side-request-forgery-vulnerability/index.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-9jm4-rg99-566c

entry.title: [phpbb/phpbb] phpBB Denial of Service
entry.content:
The fulltext search component in phpBB before 3.2.6 allows Denial of Service.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-9826
  • https://www.phpbb.com/community/viewtopic.php?f=14&t=2509941
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2019/04/29/3
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6pgr-x867-h7jx

entry.title: [phpbb/phpbb] phpBB Remote Code Execution
entry.content:
Passing an absolute path to a file_exists check in phpBB before 3.2.4 allows Remote Code Execution through Object Injection by employing Phar deserialization when an attacker has access to the Admin Control Panel with founder permissions.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-19274
  • https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2018/11/msg00029.html
  • https://www.phpbb.com/community/viewtopic.php?f=14&t=2492206
  • https://blog.ripstech.com/2018/phpbb3-phar-deserialization-to-remote-code-execution
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-h3mr-q96r-37v4

entry.title: [movingbytes/social-network] SocialNetwork Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability
entry.content:
A Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) was discovered in 'SocialNetwork v1.2.1'. The vulnerability exists due to insufficient filtration of user-supplied data (mail) passed to the 'SocialNetwork-andrea/app/template/pw_forgot.php' URL. An attacker could execute arbitrary HTML and script code in a browser in the context of the vulnerable website. A patch for the vulnerability is available at https://github.com/andreas83/SocialNetwork/commit/1b0799d08fda2f3099beaae1234b8b468deb8db1

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-7390
  • https://github.com/andreas83/SocialNetwork/issues/84
  • http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/97312
  • https://github.com/andreas83/SocialNetwork/commit/1b0799d08fda2f3099beaae1234b8b468deb8db1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3fm8-7gpf-p8fm

entry.title: [codeigniter4/framework] CodeIgniter arbitrary code execution
entry.content:
system/libraries/Email.php in CodeIgniter before 3.1.3 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by leveraging control over the email->from field to insert sendmail command-line arguments.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2016-10131
  • http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96851
  • https://www.codeigniter.com/userguide3/changelog.html#bug-fixes-for-3-1-3
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2pcj-76hj-xqhm

entry.title: [codeigniter4/framework] CodeIgniter Improper Privilege Management
entry.content:
CodeIgniter through 4.0.0 allows remote attackers to gain privileges via a modified Email ID to the "Select Role of the User" page. NOTE: A contributor to the CodeIgniter framework argues that the issue should not be attributed to CodeIgniter. Furthermore, the blog post reference shows an unknown website built with the CodeIgniter framework but that CodeIgniter is not responsible for introducing this issue because the framework has never provided a login screen, nor any kind of login or user management facilities beyond a Session library. Also, another reporter indicates the issue is with a custom module/plugin to CodeIgniter, not CodeIgniter itself.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-10793
  • https://codeigniter4.github.io/userguide/extending/authentication.html
  • https://medium.com/@vbharad/account-takeover-via-modifying-email-id-codeigniter-framework-ca30741ad297
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jwqp-wh5g-4gmm

entry.title: [verbb/knock-knock] Knock Knock plugin Open redirection vulnerability
entry.content:
The Knock Knock plugin before 1.2.8 for Craft CMS allows malicious redirection.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-13486
  • https://github.com/verbb/knock-knock/blob/craft-3/CHANGELOG.md
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-m69r-4h68-xq7j

entry.title: [verbb/knock-knock] Knock Knock plugin IP Whitelist bypass via an X-Forwarded-For HTTP header
entry.content:
The Knock Knock plugin before 1.2.8 for Craft CMS allows IP Whitelist bypass via an X-Forwarded-For HTTP header.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-13485
  • https://github.com/verbb/knock-knock/blob/craft-3/CHANGELOG.md
  • https://limpidsecurity.pl/security-advisories/1/knock-knock-plugin-for-craft-cms
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-wxvr-qqm7-6h65

entry.title: [phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin] phpMyAdmin unsanitized Git information
entry.content:
phpMyAdmin before 4.9.2 does not escape certain Git information, related to libraries/classes/Display/GitRevision.php and libraries/classes/Footer.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-19617
  • https://github.com/phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin/commit/1119de642b136d20e810bb20f545069a01dd7cc9
  • https://github.com/phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin/compare/RELEASE_4_9_1...RELEASE_4_9_2
  • https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/12/msg00006.html
  • https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/10/msg00024.html
  • https://www.phpmyadmin.net/news/2019/11/22/phpmyadmin-492-released
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-pgph-mc4p-f8c3

entry.title: [phpbb/phpbb] phpBB Server side request forgery (SSRF)
entry.content:
Server side request forgery (SSRF) in phpBB before 3.2.6 allows checking for the existence of files and services on the local network of the host through the remote avatar upload function.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-11767
  • https://www.phpbb.com/community/viewtopic.php?f=14&t=2509941
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4hx9-p925-qcv7

entry.title: [phpbb/phpbb] phpBB Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
entry.content:
phpBB version 3.2.7 allows the stealing of an Administration Control Panel session id by leveraging CSRF in the Remote Avatar feature. The CSRF Token Hijacking leads to stored XSS

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-13376
  • https://ssd-disclosure.com/archives/4007/ssd-advisory-phpbb-csrf-token-hijacking-leading-to-stored-xss
  • https://blog.phpbb.com/category/security
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6mh2-98gr-wv76

entry.title: [phpbb/phpbb] phpBB Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
entry.content:
In phpBB before 3.1.7-PL1, includes/acp/acp_bbcodes.php has improper verification of a CSRF token on the BBCode page in the Administration Control Panel. An actual CSRF attack is possible if an attacker also manages to retrieve the session id of a reauthenticated administrator prior to targeting them.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-16993
  • https://github.com/phpbb/phpbb/commit/18abef716ecf42a35416444f3f84f5459d573789
  • https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/09/msg00036.html
  • https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/10/msg00006.html
  • https://www.phpbb.com/community/viewtopic.php?t=2352606
  • https://www.phpbb.com/support/documents.php?mode=changelog&version=3#v317
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-vj3x-vfm4-hvxc

entry.title: [phpbb/phpbb] phpBB Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
entry.content:
phpBB 3.2.8 allows a CSRF attack that can modify a group avatar.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-5501
  • https://www.phpbb.com/community/viewtopic.php?f=14&t=2534536
  • https://blog.phpbb.com/category/security
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-cpqc-g4r8-6hxg

entry.title: [phpbb/phpbb] phpBB Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
entry.content:
Missing form token validation in phpBB 3.2.7 allows CSRF in deleting post attachments.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-16107
  • https://www.phpbb.com/community/viewforum.php?f=14
  • https://www.phpbb.com/community/viewtopic.php?t=2523271
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-wg24-9xm9-593v

entry.title: [phpbb/phpbb] phpBB arbitrary CSS injection
entry.content:
phpBB 3.2.7 allows adding an arbitrary Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) token sequence to a page through BBCode.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-16108
  • https://www.phpbb.com/community/viewtopic.php?t=2523271
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8hc2-hvrc-x4qr

entry.title: [verbb/image-resizer] Image Resizer Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
entry.content:
An issue was discovered in the Image Resizer plugin before 2.0.9 for Craft CMS. There are CSRF issues with the log-clear controller action.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-13458
  • https://github.com/verbb/image-resizer/blob/craft-3/CHANGELOG.md
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5v5q-3m7m-97j7
